title: 'Minimoons': Rocks Circling Near Earth Could Be A Chunk Of The Moon
content: A whole population of 'minimoons' - tiny natural satellites - may be quietly circling near Earth, scientists now believe, after discovering a second Moon-origin rock drifting close to our planet.

title: Why Vatican Closely Watches What Cardinals Eat Before Papal Enclave
content: As the world awaits the May 7 Papal Conclave in Rome, a part of what remains under scrutiny as the world looks to elect the new pope is the food cardinals eat.

title: "If Missiles Are Going To Rain...": Experts On "Cost" Of India-Pak War
content: As emotions run high in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, a former diplomat has warned that public mood should not dictate a war with Pakistan.

title: UK To Share Kohinoor With India? What Indian-Origin British Minister Said
content: The United Kingdom is in talks with India to ensure shared access and benefit from historical artefacts like the Kohinoor diamond, said Lisa Nandy, Britain's Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport.

title: Xi Jinping To Visit Moscow For Russia's Victory Day Event On May 7-10
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping will make an official visit to Russia from May 7-10, where he will participate in celebrations of the 80th anniversary of the defeat of Nazi Germany, the Kremlin said on Sunday.

title: Bengal ISC Topper Drops Her Surname, Says 'Humanism' Only Religion
content: Srijani, who aspires to pursue research in pure science like her father, said she never saw herself as the typical studious type.

title: Vladimir Putin Rules Out Using Nuclear Weapons Against Ukraine
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said in comments broadcast on Sunday said that the need to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine had not arisen, and that he hoped it would not arise.

title: Girl Went To Return Items She Bought, Shopkeeper Refused. She Then Did This
content: According to the general shop owner, the girl used to buy items from his shop, use them for a while, and then insist him to take them back and return the money.

title: India-Pakistan Tensions Live Updates: Pakistan Opens Firing Across LoC Again, Air Force Chief Meets PM Modi
content: The situation remains tense between India and Pakistan in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack. Facing irrefutable allegations of exporting terror over the decades, Islamabad is now trying diversionary tactics to avoid accountability.

title: Video: Houthi Ballistic Missile Strikes Near Israel's Biggest Airport
content: The ballistic missile fired by the Iran-backed Houthis in Yemen hit near Israel's Ben Gurion Airport after "several attempts" to intercept it failed, the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) said on Sunday.

title: 2 Arrested In Punjab For Leaking Information On Army, Air Force To Pakistan
content: A case has been registered against both the accused under the Official Secrets Act, and further investigation is underway.

title: India Blocks X Accounts Of Imran Khan, Bilawal Bhutto Amid Tensions With Pakistan
content: The Indian government on Sunday blocked the X accounts of Pakistan Peoples Party Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari and former Pakistani Prime Minister and PTI founder Imran Khan.

title: "We Look For Partners, Not Preachers": S Jaishankar Takes A Swipe At Europe
content: Taking a swipe at European nations trying to influence New Delhi's stand on geopolitical issues, External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar has said India looks for partners, "not preachers" and some of Europe is "still struggling with that problem".

title: 3 Soldiers Killed As Army Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In Jammu And Kashmir's Ramban
content: Two soldiers were killed after an Indian Army vehicle fell into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district.

title: PM Modi Meets Air Chief Marshal AP Singh Amid India-Pakistan Tensions: Sources
content: Air Chief Marshal AP Singh today met Prime Minister Narendra Modi amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan over the Pahalgam terror attack, which killed 26 people on April 22, sources said.

title: "Proud" Justin Trudeau Reacts To Son's New Music Video, Clip Viral
content: The music video itself shows Xav dancing alongside two others in a room wallpapered with newspapers, with occasional grainy footage of a moving car.

title: AI flight from Delhi diverted after missile strike near Tel Aviv airport
content: Air India flight AI139, flying from Delhi to Tel Aviv, was diverted to Abu Dhabi after a missile strike occurred near Tel Aviv airport on Sunday. The Boeing 787 was about an hour away from landing when the incident prompted the diversion while it was in Jordanian airspace. Consequently, the return flight from Tel Aviv to Delhi has been cancelled.

title: 'India needs partners, not preachers': Jaishankar once again tears into EU
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar criticizes European nations for their inconsistent stances on global issues. He emphasizes India's need for partners rather than those who preach without practicing. Jaishankar highlights Europe's need for a reality check. He recalls past statements on managing relations with China. He also points out the EU's contrasting responses to the Russia-Ukraine war and India-Pakistan tensions.

title: Warren Buffet says Apple under Cook has contributed to Berkshire more than ...
content: Warren Buffett lauded Tim Cook's leadership at Apple, acknowledging his significant contribution to Berkshire Hathaway's financial gains. Despite reducing Berkshire's Apple stake, Buffett emphasized Cook's unique ability to develop Apple, drawing a comparison to Steve Jobs. Since Cook became CEO in 2011, Apple's stock has surged, driving its market capitalization to over $3 trillion.

title: Sikh student confronts Rahul Gandhi on 1984 riots, Operation Blue Star; he responds
content: During a US visit, Rahul Gandhi encountered tough questions from a Sikh student. The query concerned the Congress party's history with the Sikh community. It specifically addressed the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. The student questioned Gandhi's stance on Sikh rights. Gandhi acknowledged past mistakes. He expressed a strong connection with the Sikh community. BJP criticized Gandhi, sharing the video.

title: Eliminated but not done! Why Riyan Parag made 3 bold changes vs KKR
content: Ajinkya Rahane, Kolkata Knight Riders' captain, chose to bat first after winning the toss against Rajasthan Royals at Eden Gardens. KKR brought in Moeen Ali and Ramandeep Singh, aiming to set a strong total. Rajasthan Royals, led by Riyan Parag, made three changes, including Hasaranga's return. Rajasthan Royals, already out of playoff contention, made three changes to their line-up.

title: RCB wicketkeeper-batter gives Romario Shepherd's a wild nickname
content: An old video of Jitesh Sharma comparing Romario Shepherd's strength to a rhino resurfaced after Shepherd's explosive 14-ball 53 against CSK. Shepherd credited his attacking nature and strength, embracing the 'rhino' nickname. He thanked Rajat Patidar and Tim David for their confidence-boosting support, while also acknowledging Dinesh Karthik's mentorship in improving his batting approach.

title: Desi startups making sexual health means Big Business
content: India's sexual health and wellness sector is experiencing rapid growth, fueled by increased awareness among younger generations and significant venture capital investments. Startups are addressing diverse needs, from fertility treatments to personal wellness products, leveraging telehealth and D2C models to overcome traditional barriers.

title: Who is Mitch Owen? PBKS rope in BBL star after Maxwell ruled out of IPL
content: Punjab Kings have signed Australian all-rounder Mitchell Owen as a replacement for Glenn Maxwell, who has been ruled out of the remainder of the 2025 IPL season due to a fractured finger. Owen, a 23-year-old Tasmanian, joins PBKS for Rs 3 crore, bringing his aggressive batting style and seam-bowling abilities to the team.

title: Microsoft has this June, July and August 'password warning' for users
content: Microsoft is discontinuing the password management features within its Authenticator app. Starting June 2024, users can no longer save new passwords, and by August 2025, all saved passwords will be inaccessible. This change encourages users to transition to Microsoft Edge for password autofill, while the Authenticator app will continue supporting passkeys for account security.

title: What Tim Cook, Jamie Dimon said on Warren Buffett's retirement move
content: Industry titans like Tim Cook and Jamie Dimon lauded Warren Buffett's remarkable legacy following his announcement to retire as Berkshire Hathaway's CEO at the end of the year. Greg Abel, currently vice chairman, is poised to succeed Buffett, a move analysts anticipated. However, Abel's appointment has drawn criticism from environmental groups, citing Berkshire Hathaway Energy's coal plant operations.

title: Artillery crisis? Pakistan’s ammo could last only 4 days in war: Report
content: Pakistan's artillery ammunition reserves are critically low, potentially limiting its capacity to sustain a war with India to just four days, according to sources. Outdated production facilities and recent arms deals with Ukraine have exacerbated the shortage. This deficit significantly impacts Pakistan's military preparedness, raising concerns among military leadership about their ability to resist potential offensives.

title: Watch: Pissed off MS Dhoni yells at Khaleel Ahmed during RCB vs CSK
content: Despite valiant efforts from Ayush Mhatre (94) and Ravindra Jadeja (77*), Chennai Super Kings fell short by two runs against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in a high-scoring chase. The loss, CSK's ninth, keeps them at the bottom. During the match, MS Dhoni expressed frustration with Khaleel Ahmed, who had a forgettable day with the ball.

title: When Neena Gupta recalled Satish Kaushik’s marriage offer after pregnancy
content: Satish Kaushik, who passed away in 2023, was a close friend of Neena Gupta since college. In a viral video, Neena recalls how Kaushik offered to marry her during her controversial 1989 pregnancy to support her. His daughter Masaba also paid heartfelt tribute after his demise.

title: TMC hits out at BJP for 'raising questions on the Pratishtha of Digha temple'
content: Following objections from the BJP regarding the naming of a newly inaugurated shrine in Digha, West Bengal, as Jagannath Dham, Trinamool Congress has accused the BJP-led Odisha government of hypocrisy. The Odisha government has ordered an investigation into the temple's name and the alleged use of surplus wood from the Puri shrine for idols.

title: "How It Started...": Musk's Nostalgic Post As SpaceX Starbase Becomes City
content: 97.7 per cent of voters approved a ballot measure to turn SpaceX's Starbase launch site into an official municipality.

title: "You Owe Your Existence To India": Asaduddin Owaisi Snubs Bangladesh Ex-Officer
content: Bangladesh army officer had said that Dhaka should collaborate with China to occupy northeastern states if it attacks Pakistan in response to the Pahalgam attack.

title: "Country So Poor...": Asaduddin Owaisi's "Failed Nation" Jab At Pakistan
content: In his fresh attack against Pakistani leaders over the war rhetoric in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, AIMIM chief and Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi has said those speaking "nonsense" in Pakistan "don't know Islam"

title: Asked To Quit Alcohol, Angry Uttar Pradesh Man Shoots Son, Daughter-In-Law
content: A retired home guard shot his son and daughter-in-law in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, when he was asked to stop drinking alcohol and fight in the house.

title: Virat Kohli creates history, becomes first ever to achieve this big IPL feat
content: Virat Kohli etched his name in IPL history, becoming the first player to score 500+ runs in eight seasons. His recent 62 off 33 balls against CSK propelled him to the Orange Cap. Kohli now leads IPL 2025 with 505 runs, averaging 63.13. RCB edged out CSK in a thrilling match, marking their first league double over their rivals.

title: 'Head open, brain spilled out': Mystery shrouds advocate’s death in Bengaluru
content: A 46-year-old advocate, H Jagadish, was found dead on NICE Road near Kengeri under mysterious circumstances. His cousin suspects foul play, citing injuries and a missing mobile phone. Police are investigating all angles, including a possible staged accident, while awaiting the autopsy report to determine the cause of death.

title: On MS Dhoni's captaincy: 'Whether the brain is still ticking for him...'
content: MS Dhoni's captaincy and batting form are under scrutiny as Chennai Super Kings suffered a narrow defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in IPL 2025. Adam Gilchrist questioned Dhoni's tactical decisions, particularly the choice of bowler in the crucial 19th over. He also pondered whether Dhoni's sharpness is waning as he nears retirement.

title: Who is Greg Abel? Top 10 things to know about Warren Buffett’s successor
content: Warren Buffett is stepping down as Berkshire Hathaway's CEO by the end of 2025, with Greg Abel, a Canadian executive, appointed as his successor. Abel, currently overseeing Berkshire's non-insurance operations, will manage the company's diverse enterprises and substantial stock investments. He faces the challenge of maintaining Berkshire's decentralised structure and replicating Buffett's market performance.

title: 'Hasne ka jokhim khud uthayein': Akhilesh's dig at BJP on laughter day
content: Taking to social media platform X, Yadav posted, "'Vishva Haasya Divas' par danda tana hai, kyunki Bhajpa raaj mein hansna mana hai. (On World Laughter Day, the stick is raised, because laughing is forbidden in the BJP's rule)"

title: Discord in Maharashtra govt over fund-shift to Ladki Bahin scheme
content: Maharashtra Minister Sanjay Shirsat expressed strong disapproval over the diversion of funds from the social justice and tribal development departments to support the Ladki Bahin scheme. He criticized the finance department's unilateral decisions, highlighting pending commitments and the potential shutdown of his department. Shirsat plans to raise the issue with the Chief Minister, deeming the fund diversion illegal.

title: Who is Munir Ahmed? CRPF jawan in soup over marriage to Pakistani woman
content: A CRPF jawan, Munir Ahmed, was dismissed for allegedly concealing his marriage to a Pakistani woman, Menal Khan, and her unauthorized stay in India. The CRPF cited violations of service rules and potential national security threats.

title: Shoot ‘love jihad’ culprits in the chest in public: MP minister Vishwas Sarang
content: Madhya Pradesh minister Vishwas Sarang sparked controversy by advocating for the public execution of individuals involved in 'love jihad' and crimes against minors. His remarks followed an incident where a rape suspect, Farhan Khan, was shot in the leg while allegedly attempting to escape police custody.

title: 'Seema Haider did black magic on me': Man travels from Gujarat, breaks into her home
content: A man named Tejas from Gujarat has been arrested for allegedly breaking into Seema Haider's house, claiming she performed "black magic" on him. Police stated that Tejas appeared to be mentally disturbed and had traveled from Gujarat to reach Seema's residence. He is currently in custody, and further investigation is underway to determine the motive behind his actions.

title: Yash Dayal vs MS Dhoni: The unseen role of Virat Kohli
content: Yash Dayal replicated his IPL 2024 heroics, again dismissing MS Dhoni in the final over to secure a thrilling win for RCB. Despite a tense finish with a no-ball and a six, Dayal's composure and Virat Kohli's unwavering support proved crucial. His father highlighted Kohli's role in boosting Dayal's confidence, enabling him to overcome past setbacks and perform fearlessly.

title: Pakistan says will 'strike' any structure India builds on Indus river
content: Speaking on a programme of Pakistan News channel Geo News on Friday, Asif said, "Certainly, if they (India) attempt to build any kind of structure, we will strike it." "Aggression is not just about firing cannons or bullets; it has many faces. One of those faces is [blocking or diverting water], which could lead to deaths due to hunger and thirst," he added.

title: Watch: Priyanka Gandhi halts convoy, ensures help for accident victim
content: "The accident occurred when the car in which Noushad, a native of Koyilandy, and his family were travelling collided with another car at Eengappuzha," captioned a video posted by the Kerala Congress on X.

title: Elon Musk’s Starbase becomes an official city in Texas: All you need to know
content: SpaceX's vision of a space exploration hub has materialized as Starbase, Texas, following a local vote. Predominantly populated by SpaceX employees, the newly incorporated city grants the company significant control over governance. This development raises concerns about corporate influence, public access, and democratic oversight in the region, as Elon Musk's ambitions reshape South Texas.

title: Pakistan envoy's nuclear threat to India amid tensions over Pahalgam attack
content: Amid escalating tensions following a deadly terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir, Pakistan's ambassador to Russia warned of using its full spectrum of power, including nuclear weapons, in response to any Indian military action or interference with its water supply.

title: Fleming reflects on controversial Brevis dismissal in RCB vs CSK
content: A contentious umpire decision marred the RCB versus CSK match in the IPL, igniting a heated argument. Dewald Brevis was adjudged out LBW to a questionable knee-high full toss. Confusion reigned as Brevis and Jadeja ran a single, unaware of the review timer. Replays later showed the delivery sliding down leg.

title: Decoding Warren Buffett’s inheritance: Who will inherit his billion-dollar empire?
content: Warren Buffett, 94, will step down as Berkshire Hathaway's CEO, naming Greg Abel as his successor. Buffett's $169 billion fortune will largely go to a new charitable trust led by his children: Susie, Howie, and Peter. This trust will focus on family values and long-term impact, marking a shift from Buffett's previous donations, including ceasing contributions to the Gates Foundation.

title: 'Sought & received permission': Sacked CRPF jawan on marrying Pakistani woman
content: A CRPF jawan, Munir Ahmed, is contesting his dismissal after being accused of concealing his marriage to a Pakistani national, despite claiming he received official permission. Ahmed asserts he informed the CRPF of his marriage and followed protocol, including applying for a Long-Term Visa for his wife.

title: Weekly Chinese Horoscope, May 4 to May 10: 3 zodiacs that need to be cautious
content: This week presents unique challenges for Tigers due to clashes with the Snake's influence, urging patience and introspection. Pigs may encounter disruptions and restlessness, necessitating flexibility and self-care. Dogs could struggle with balancing responsibilities, requiring reliance on intuition and a steady routine to navigate the week effectively.

title: Watch: Ukraine claims it shot down Russian fighter jet from sea drone for first time
content: Ukraine's Defence Intelligence announced the downing of a Russian Su-30 fighter jet in the Black Sea using a seaborne drone, a world first. The $50 million aircraft was reportedly destroyed near Novorossiisk. Meanwhile, a Russian drone strike on Kharkiv injured 47 people, prompting Zelenskyy to urge stronger support from allies for air defense.

title: 'No welcome, till there is revenge': Minister refuses to accept bouquet at an event
content: Union Minister CR Patil, in a strong statement against terrorism, refused all welcoming gestures at a Gujarat event following the Pahalgam attack that killed 26. Patil declared he would not accept bouquets or mementos until the terrorists are brought to justice.

title: Sonu Nigam continues work promotions following FIR over alleged hurtful remarks
content: Playback singer Sonu Nigam faces legal trouble after an FIR was filed against him for allegedly making offensive remarks against the Kannadiga community during a Bengaluru concert. The complaint accuses Nigam of hurting sentiments and inciting linguistic tensions. Nigam has issued a clarification, denying targeting the community and explaining his statement was against linguistic extremism.

title: Digital vs Manual: Which is the most accurate Blood Pressure machine and why?
content: High blood pressure (hypertension) is a condition where blood pressure consistently measures 130/80 mm Hg or higher. It's often referred to as the "silent killer" because it usually has no noticeable symptoms until complications arise. Low blood pressure (hypotension) is a condition where blood pressure is consistently low, generally less than 90/60 mm Hg. If chrnoic, it can cause dizziness, lightheadedness, and fainting

title: Nuggets get desired 'result' from surprise firings
content: A Nuggets executive pointed to the firings of Michael Malone and Calvin Booth as the reason behind the team's late-season surge that has them into the second round.

title: Rantanen's 'fitting' hat trick caps Stars' G7 win
content: Mikko Rantanen scored three goals in the third period, and the Dallas Stars utilized a furious rally to advance to the second round of the Stanley Cup playoffs, defeating the Colorado Avalanche 4-2 in Game 7 on Saturday night at American Airlines Center.

title: Sovereignty outduels Journalism to capture Derby
content: Sovereignty outdueled Journalism down the stretch on a muddy track to capture the 151st Kentucky Derby on Saturday at Churchill Downs.

title: Twins' Clemens homers at Fenway in front of dad
content: Kody Clemens, the son of former Red Sox pitcher Roger Clemens, homered into the right-field seats in the sixth inning during his first game at Fenway Park.

title: Canelo cruises, locks up Sept. clash with Crawford
content: After an uneventful decision victory over William Scull, Canelo Alvarez made things official with Terence Crawford as the two faced off in the ring to announce their Sept. 12 superfight.

title: Scheffler's 54-hole lead largest on tour since '11
content: Scottie Scheffler's lead at the CJ Cup Byron Nelson is 8 shots as he stands at 23 under entering the final round Sunday.

title: Fan who fell at PNC Park awake, shows 'progress'
content: Kavan Markwood, the 20-year-old who slipped off a railing during the seventh inning of the Pittsburgh Pirates' 4-3 win over the Chicago Cubs on Wednesday night, is awake and alert, according to Jennifer Phillips, who has organized a fundraiser for him.

title: 🏀 What this coaching change means for the Spurs
content: What's next for San Antonio after Pop's move to the front office? What does Mitch Johnson bring? Our NBA insiders break down the news.

title: Which Braves are the REAL Braves?
content: No team has made the playoffs after starting 0-7, but Atlanta has played better since. Will that continue -- and will it be enough?

title: Handing out April grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: Is your favorite team acing -- or flunking -- the early part of the 2025 season? We break it all down.

title: Terence Crawford is the opponent Canelo Alvarez -- and boxing fans -- need
content: After another less-than-exciting performance, Canelo Alvarez's next fight is finally what boxing fans deserve.

title: Neither parenthood nor McLaren can slow Verstappen in Miami
content: There's a myth in racing that becoming a parent makes a racer slow down. Max Verstappen is proving that wrong.

title: Arsenal ratings: Gunners poor beyond Rice, Ødegaard in loss to Bournemouth
content: Arsenal made it three league games without a win as a poor second half swung things in Bournemouth's favor. The one plus: no injuries ahead of a pivotal Champions League semifinal, second leg, at PSG this Wednesday.

title: The worst game in Premier League history? Southampton might just be the worst team
content: The game was so bad, some fans called it "El Crapico," a game between the two worst teams in the league.

title: Messi scores in Miami rout to snap losing streak
content: Lionel Messi struck the emphatic final goal as Inter Miami snapped a three-game losing streak with a 4-1 home win over the New York Red Bulls.

title: Kane comes within 1 min of trophy as Bayern draw
content: RB Leipzig's Yussuf Poulsen scored a stoppage-time goal to snatch a 3-3 draw against Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich on Saturday and delay the Bavarians' title celebrations by at least a day.

title: Barcelona survive scare to stay clear of Madrid
content: Barcelona extended the gap atop LaLiga to seven points with a 2-1 comeback win at relegated Real Valladolid on Saturday thanks to second-half strikes by Raphinha and Fermin Lopez.

title: Arteta: 'Rage' from loss must fuel Arsenal vs. PSG
content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta called on his players to harness their rage from Saturday's 2-1 home defeat by Bournemouth in Wednesday's Champions League semifinal second leg at PSG.

title: U.S. duo Balogun, Dike net 1st goals since injuries
content: United States and Monaco striker Folarin Balogun scored his first Ligue 1 goal this year following shoulder surgery.

title: Napoli win to move step closer to Serie A title
content: League leaders Napoli moved one step closer to winning the Serie A title with a 1-0 win at relegation-threatened Lecce on Saturday, taking the visitors provisionally six points clear of Scudetto rivals Inter Milan.

title: Leicester game delayed as ref suffers head injury
content: Leicester's clash with Southampton was held up for 11 minutes after referee David Webb was forced out of the game after being injured in a collision.

title: Firmino captains Al Ahli to 1st Asian CL title
content: Saudi Arabia's Al Ahli beat Japan's Kawasaki Frontale 2-0 to win the Asian Champions League Elite title for the first time at a raucous King Abdullah Sports City Stadium.

title: 12 reasons why Naoya Inoue defines must-see boxing
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. breaks down Inoue's game in 12 categories, from offense to defense and power and speed.

title: Luck Index 2025: Who needs luck on their side next season?
content: Turnover luck, coordinator upgrade, transfer portal haul? They all could lead to some upswings for a select few teams.

title: 'We've got the identity that fits us': Wisconsin turns back the clock to move forward
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell is going back to the Badgers' roots in a crucial Year 3 for his program.

title: Fatherhood, a decade in F1 give Verstappen perspective on what's important
content: Max Verstappen's role as a dad isn't the only reason for his increasingly elder-statesman status in F1.

title: How Wrexham paid their way to promotion, and why the Premier League requires more than that
content: Wrexham's promotion might look miraculous, but it's actually a combination of factors that other Premier League hopefuls shouldn't try to replicate.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Huijsen to pick Liverpool, Arsenal or Chelsea
content: Dean Huijsen's future could be decided this month with Chelsea, Arsenal and Liverpool all in the race. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Draft tiers at guard
content: Eric Moody goes through the different tiers at the guard position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Wetzel: Never mind the girlfriend kerfuffle. Belichick will always be fine.
content: belichick is arguably the greatest coach in the history of the sport . his jump to the college ranks and the University of North Carolina is of great intrigue . he's running point on publicity for his new book, "The Art of Winning: Lessons from My Life in Football"

title: NBA playoffs: How to bet each second-round series
content: the second round of the playoffs is here, with Cleveland and Indiana set to tip off Sunday . the Cavaliers are not as good as their record and the Pacers dominated Milwaukee . for latest odds go to ESPN BET Pacers to win series (+360)

title: What must Liverpool address in summer transfer window?
content: Virgil van Dijk, Mohamed Salah and Trent Alexander-Arnold would have to face tough negotiations with three of their top players . the trio won the premier league by a sizeable margin, two of the big free agents extended the league . they'd have to do it off the back of £57 million in losses .

title: Five rookies with breakout potential
content: the WNBA is a hard league to break into, but rookies are making an impact earlier than ever . in 2023, I recommended not drafting any rookies that weren't the overall no. 1 pick, Aliyah Boston . the 2024 draft class was an outlier from previous history; all four lottery picks averaged over 20 fantasy points per game .

title: Fever hopeful Clark (leg) returns Sunday at Iowa
content: caitlin Clark missed the Fever 's exhibition opener Saturday because of a left leg injury . she is expected to play Sunday when she takes on the Brazil national team at the University of Iowa . "her communication was outstanding," coach Stephanie white says .

title: NBA playoffs 2025: Everything to know about this weekend's massive Game 7s
content: the Clippers force a game 7 against the Nuggets . the two teams will meet on Sunday (8:30 p.m. ET, TNT) with a chance to face the Timberwolves in the second round .

title: Western Conference playoffs: Nuggets close out the Clippers in Game 7 rout
content: the 2024-25 playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the winner of the series will take on the Timberwolves . on friday, the no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets beat the No. 5 seed LA Clippers in a Game 7 showdown .

title: Round-by-round: Canelo Alvarez outpoints William Scull, fails to shine
content: canelo Alvarez regained the undisputed super middleweight championship with a unanimous decision victory over William Scull . he won by scorecards of 115-113, 116-112 and 119-109 . alvarez is now moving on to face Terence Crawford on sept. 12 at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas .

title: All Pakistan citizens staying illegally be identified: Sukanta Majumdar
content: West Bengal Police on Saturday arrested a Pakistani national from Hooghly district for allegedly overstaying in India for 45 years after arriving on a tourist visa in 1980

title: Stalin announces solatium for family of couple killed after falling from an under-construction bridge in Tiruppur accident
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin on Sunday condoled the deaths and announced a solatium of ₹3 lakh to the families of each of the deceased

title: NLC land acquisition issue figured in meeting held by Union Coal Secretary with CS to strengthen energy security in Tamil Nadu
content: The deliberations focussed on the State’s projected power demand, availability of lignite and coal, and proactive measures required to meet peak load conditions during the summer and monsoon seasons, the NLC India Ltd. said

title: Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh meets PM Modi
content: The meeting came less than 24 hours after Navy Chief Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi apprised the Prime Minister on the overall situation in the critical sea lanes in the Arabian Sea

title: Army vehicle plunges into gorge in J&K’s Ramban, three soldiers killed
content: The army truck was part of a convoy moving from Jammu to Srinagar along National Highway 44 when the accident occurred near Battery Chashma at around 11.30 a.m

title: In frames | Kashmiriyat in their hearts
content: The local community, deeply affected by decades of protracted conflict, is rallying in unison to restore Kashmir’s reputation as a safe and welcoming destination for tourists; the hotel industry is also reaching out with freebies

title: Goa stampede: Minor incident happened at same site during last year's fest, says official
content: We have gathered that a similar incident, but on a minor scale, had happened during the temple festival last year at the same spot, a senior government official said

title: PM Modi made 'desperate U-turn' on caste census: Congress
content: Posing three questions to the Prime Minister, Mr. Ramesh asked whether he will have the honesty to acknowledge that his government has officially changed its policy on the caste census over the last 11 years

title: Kallakurichi police rule out foul play in accident involving Madurai Adheenam’s vehicle, warn action against those spreading false information
content: Police said following information that the SUV in which the Adheenam was met with an accident at the Salem roundabout near Ulundurpet, a police team rushed to the spot for investigation

title: I did not say Fazil’s family members were innocent in Suhan Shetty’s murder: U.T. Khader
content: UT Khader was responding to comments by Mangaluru City North MLA Y. Bharath Shetty and other BJP leaders

title: K.V. Rabiya, champion of Kerala’s literacy movement, passes away
content: Even though her life was marked with challenges including polio, breast cancer, spinal injury and two COVID-19 infections, Rabiya illuminated countless lives with the power of knowledge

title: A.P. govt. committed to strengthen healthcare infra: Minister
content: Health Minister Satya Kumar Yadav inaugurates two dialysis centres at Vinjamuru and Podalakuru Community Health Centres respectively in the SPSR Nellore district

title: Vande Bharat train between Bengaluru and Dharwad to be extended to Belagavi
content: MP Jagadish Shettar said that the extension has been approved by Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Footage captures moment Yemen missile strikes near Israel’s main airport
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. title: Death toll rises to 3 in Jharkhand's hospital corridor collapse
content: Two others, who were injured in the incident, are undergoing treatment, he said. Jharkhand Health Minister Irfan Ansari said three people died in the hospital corridor collapse

title: Sudden shower, gusty winds take scorching Vijayawada by surprise
content: The India Meteorological Department had issued a warning for severe thunderstorms in Krishna district, including Vijayawada

title: Man breaks into Seema Haider's house in Noida
content: Police identified the accused as Tejas, a resident of Surender Nagar in Gujarat. They said that Tejas seemed "mentally disturbed" and tried to enter Seema's residence around 7 p.m.

title: Manipur’s Meitei, Thadou groups push for NRC, free movement
content: Organisations of the two communities demand deletion of ‘Any Kuki Tribes’ from the Scheduled Tribe list while vowing to protect the State’s territorial integrity

title: Domestic violence, assault among most reported crimes to NCW
content: Other significant categories included dowry harassment with 916 complaints, rape and attempt to rape with 394, and molestation or outraging the modesty of women, with 310 complaints

title: 39 arrested in Assam for 'defending Pakistan' after Pahalgam terror attack
content: On Friday, Mr. Sarma threatened to break the legs of those who raised the 'Pakistan zindabad' slogan in the aftermath of the Jammu and Kashmir terror attack

title: Two held in Amritsar on charge of spying
content: Preliminary investigation revealed their links to Pakistani intelligence operatives, established through Harpreet Singh alias Pittu currently lodged in Amritsar Central Jail, police said

title: Padma Shri awardee Baba Sivanand dies in Varanasi
content: Recognised for his contributions to yoga and spirituality, Baba Sivanand was conferred with the Padma Shri in 2022

title: India conducts maiden flight-trials of stratospheric airship platform in Madhya Pradesh
content: The airship platform was launched with an instrumental payload to an altitude of around 17 kms, according to the Defence Ministry

title: Modi congratulates Lawrence Wong on re-election
content: “Heartiest congratulations @LawrenceWongST on your resounding victory in the general elections. India and Singapore share a strong and multifaceted partnership, underpinned by close people-to-people ties,” Modi said on X

title: The mechanics of crowd control: anticipation, preparation, prevention
content: Crowd crush tragedies in India rooted in poor infrastructure, socioeconomic inequality, and flawed planning expose systemic neglect rather than crowd behaviour

title: Pune-Nashik railway corridor realignment being finalised: Vaishnaw
content: The earlier alignment of the proposed high-speed rail corridor passed through the 15-km restricted zone around the Giant Metrewave Radio Telescope (GMRT) at Khodad village near Narayangaon, around 60 km from Pune

title: Portals of Badrinath open, temple adorned with 15 tons of flowers
content: Officials here said the local administration has completed all the necessary preparations to make the journey to the Dham safe and smooth

title: Naidu and Pawan failed to take up SCS issue with Prime Minister, says CPI leader Narayana
content: The Centre has taken responsibility for only 10% of ₹15,000 crore WB loan for construction of capital Amaravati, he says

title: Water-sharing row: Plea filed in HC against deployment of Punjab Police at Bhakra headworks
content: According to the petition filed by advocate Ravinder Singh Dhull, the Punjab government has "illegally deployed" cops at the BBMB Bhakra headworks and Lohand Khud escape channel while flouting all constitutional duties

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistan shuts ports for Indian ships after New Delhi bans imports from Islamabad
content: The Pakistan Army, meanwhile, said in a statement that it has conducted a successful training launch of the Abdali Weapon System — a surface-to-surface missile with a range of 450 km

title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah unveils Ambedkar statue
content: Siddaramaiah was speaking after unveiling a 14-feet-high bronze statue of B.R Ambedkar at Yelahanka in Bengaluru

title: Dalit seers seek funds for mutts; meets CM Siddaramaiah
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah assured the seers that funds would be allocated to mutts in the coming days

title: Waqf Act: AIMPLB questions correctness of Centre's affidavit in SC
content: The board has expressed serious objections to the statement made by the government that there has been a "shocking increase" in the number of Waqf properties uploaded in the central portal after 2013

title: Sahitya Akademi invites entries for translation prize
content: The annual award honours outstanding translations of literary works into the 24 Indian languages recognised by the akademi

title: Rain, thunderstorm likely in Delhi; IMD issues 'orange' alert for hailstorm in Himachal
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast winds reaching speeds of 40-50 kilometres per hour for the national capital, with a 'yellow' alert

title: Perseverance is key to success, Union Minister tells women entrepreneurs
content: Pemmasani Chandrasekhar inaugurates ADITRI, a rural entrepreneurship initiative, at SRM University-AP

title: India abruptly recalls IMF Executive Director K. V. Subramanian 6 months ahead of tenure
content: According to the sources, Mr. Subramanian is learnt to have raised questions about the IMF's datasets, which did not go down well in the corridors of the multilateral agency

title: Over 72,000 candidates to take NEET (UG)-2025 in Telangana today
content: In all, 72,507 candidates have registered for the test in Telangana, and it will be conducted from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. in 190 examination centres across the State

title: New Delhi's plan to ask IMF to review Pak. loans is politically motivated: Islamabad
content: The IMF Executive Board is scheduled to meet Pakistan officials on May 9 for the first review of the Extended Funding Facility

title: ICAR to launch two genome edited rice varieties
content: The ICAR says development of such seeds is ‘first-ever such achievement’ in the country using cutting-edge genome editing technology

title: Pakistani Ranger apprehended by BSF from international border in Rajasthan
content: The development comes nearly a fortnight after a BSF jawan was apprehended by the Rangers amid rising tension between the two countries in the wake of the terrorist attack in Pahalgam

title: What are the key objectives of caste count?
content: Why is the BJP government’s decision a surprise? What are the challenges the exercise will throw up? What are the complexities? What will it mean for the reservation ceiling? Which are the States that have already conducted a caste enumeration?

title: Governor is mere rubber stamp post: Stalin
content: Speaking at an event held in Chennai, he says the State government not only provides land and financial resources to set up universities and colleges but also gives salaries to staff and provides amenities to students; he questions the reasoning behind letting the Governor nominate Vice-Chancellors

title: Distress in the salt pans
content: The vibrant salt manufacturing industry of Tamil Nadu, where nine coastal districts produce salt, finds itself in the doldrums, thanks to a variety of factors. In this deep dive, Deepa H. Ramakrishnan finds out what ails the industry and how these issues can be resolved

title: At The Huddle, players from three generations to take the field for women’s cricket in India
content: At The Hindu Huddle session titled ‘No Boundaries: Growth of women’s cricket in India’, Shanta Rangaswamy, India’s first women’s team captain and a former BCCI apex council member; Mithali Raj, former India captain; and Shreyanka Patil, India international and Royal Challengers Bengaluru cricketer, will talk us through the journey of women’s cricket

title: Two Americans detained at Mizoram airport, sent back to Delhi
content: The American citizens worked with a number of non-government organisations in Bangladesh’s Chittagong area, raising suspicions about the purpose of their visit to Mizoram, says an official

title: With CRMP on hold, monsoons could bring back potholes for city commuters
content: Three months have passed since the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation submitted the proposals for extension of CRMP for five more years, but the government is yet to take a decision on the issue

title: Modi doubles down on commitment to take ‘firm and decisive’ action against Pahalgam perpetrators
content: PM’s comments come amidst calls for de-escalation, Lavrov, EU FM Kallas speak to Jaishankar, Modi meets Angola President

title: Groundwater exploitation in rural Bengaluru threat to drinking water systems: Study
content: The research report identifies that the problem is largely driven by the free supply of electricity to farmers for irrigation borewells

title: Indian Bank Q4 profit soars 32% to ₹2,956 crore helped by improvement in core income
content: During the quarter, the bank's total income increased to ₹18,599 crore from ₹16,887 crore a year ago, Indian Bank said in a regulatory filing.

title: In a historic first, Kolkata Port launches night navigation for round-the-clock vessel movement
content: This development is expected to enable more vessels to enter and leave the port daily, therefore increasing efficiency and overall trade activities handled by the port.

title: Inside Quinn Ewers' draft and post-slide motivation
content: Quinn Ewers was in pain, couldn't eat very much, if at all . he had four wisdom teeth extracted, one left an exposed nerve that had him hurting . his agent felt almost assured he would be picked before the last round .

title: After 2 transfers and 5 seasons, the Titans' made Cam Ward's dreams come true
content: cam Ward was drafted by the Titans in the 2025 draft . he played his final college season at a school that's never had a player drafted to the NFL . his early collegiate days began in front of 6,000 people on game days .

title: U.K. and India can be exemplars of how you can use culture to bring people closer together: U.K. Culture Secretary
content: During a three-day visit to India, U.K. Culture Secretary Lisa Nandy emphasised the significance of a newly signed bilateral Cultural Cooperation Agreement designed to foster deeper ties between British and Indian creative sectors and museums

title: Tripura signs MoU with the IIM to provide advanced training to Panchayat officials
content: The signing took place during National Panchayat Day celebrations on Saturday; on the occasion, the Chief Minister acknowledged efforts of Panchayats in delivering effective rural governance recognised through national awards

title: Children of Kurukkankundu in Agali seek Collector’s help for road, power
content: They say basic facilities are being denied to them because of the objections raised by the Forest department

title: Social activist Mano Bakthavatsalam passes away at 95
content: She was a committee member of the Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan, was honorary secretary of the Women’s Voluntary Service of Tamil Nadu

title: AIADMK-BJP alliance has left Stalin frustrated: Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: Speaking at a public meeting in Chennai’s T. Nagar, he alleged that the DMK has no principles or ideology and only seeks power, focusing on dynastic and family politics

title: Kharge objects to confining Ambedkar’s legacy only to Dalits
content: Mallikarjun Kharge presents a handwritten letter by Ambedkar to counter BJP’s repeated allegations that Congress was responsible his defeat in the 1952 general elections

title: Congress demands BJP MLA’s disqualification after High Court upholds his conviction
content: A sessions court in Aklera had convicted Kanwar Lal Meena in December 2020 after finding him guilty of obstructing government work, intimidating government officials, and vandalising property

title: Multiple-level probes into fire outbreak at Kozhikode MCH
content: Preliminary post-mortem report rules out possibility of inhalation of smoke as the cause of death of five patients on ventilator support

title: All arrangements in place for Pooram, says Minister Vasavan
content: Safety checks completed on all Corporation buildings, and dangerous overhanging tree branches removed. No communal, political, or provocative symbols, slogans, or flags should be used as part of the festival

title: Bengaluru’s restaurants see self-delivery systems as alternative to aggregators
content: While the issue of commission is a huge burden that restaurants are not able to cope with when it comes to the apps which have a duopoly in the market, in the case of ONDC, there are logistical issues concerning last mile-connectivity

title: Twin brothers top district in Odisha Class X exam with identical scores
content: The brothers scored 560 out of 600 marks in this year’s matriculation examination, results of which were announced by the Board of Secondary Education (BSE), Odisha on May 2

title: Pahalgam terrorist attack: Terrorists mingled with crowd, herded them towards armed members who killed tourists at Baisaran
content: As the gunshots rang out at Pahalgam on April 22, two terrorists who had earlier mingled with the tourists, deliberately guided the people towards two other armed assailants to prevent the crowd from scattering, say officials; the terrorists had fled into forests before the reinforcements arrived
